de.iabg.mesh
Class DefaultMeshConnectionModel

java.lang.Object
  de.iabg.mesh.DefaultMeshConnectionModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, MeshConnectionModel, Loggable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RigidMeshConnectionModel
public class DefaultMeshConnectionModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements MeshConnectionModel

This implementation of MeshConnectionModel attempts to create all the functionality described in the MeshConnectionModel class description. Refer to the class API for more details. Much of the implementation of this class should be straight-forward, however, a more in-depth summary of the connection algorithm may clarify some conceptual issues. There exist two NodeMatrix objects, one for the First Nodes and one for the Last Nodes. A NodeCorrelationMatrix is created by calling NodeMatrix.getReducedDistanceCorrelation(de.iabg.mesh.NodeMatrix, de.iabg.swing.KeyList, de.iabg.swing.KeyList) and using the First Nodes, Last Nodes, and their corresponding node keys as arguments. Once that has been completed, a NodeConnectionMatrix with a maximum distance tolerance is created by calling NodeCorrelationMatrix.getPreferredConnection(double). In these two steps, the two NodeMatrix objects are connected. To render the connected nodes in Java3D, a similar procedure is done as in DefaultMeshModel for edges, triangles and quadrilaterals. The scene of the First Mesh and the scene of the Last Mesh are rendered first. After that, copies of the First Nodes and Last Nodes are sorted according to the corresponding connected nodes in the stored NodeConnectionMatrix. The two resulting NodeMatrix objects can then be added to the Java3D scene.

Version:
November 1, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Constructor Detail

DefaultMeshConnectionModel

public DefaultMeshConnectionModel(JMeshConnectionPanel connectionPanel)
Constructs a DefaultMeshConnectionModel with no stored data. This constructor also initializes all the storage objects, which should not be destroyed during the life of this object. This is because listeners may register themselves to these objects, and will not receive notifications if the references to these objects are changed. This constructor also stores a reference to the JMeshConnectionPanel, so that this model has access to all the methods of that component.

Parameters:
connectionPanel - the JMeshConnectionPanel that this model is designed for
